intro: Lastrea walkerae var. bipinnata, commonly known as the bipinnate lastrea, is a rare and unique plant native to specific regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its succulent characteristics and adapted to arid environments. The plant features a distinctive bipinnate leaf structure, with finely divided leaves that give it a feathery appearance. Its small, star-shaped flowers are typically yellow or orange, adding to its ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
